intro: Manulea adenocalyx, commonly known as the golden sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking golden-yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture, while its stems are erect and branching. Manulea adenocalyx is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
